info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 5:47PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hamilton and north central Fulton Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 546 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Caroga Lake, or 14 miles northwest of Gloversville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wells, Sacandaga Campground, Hope, Arietta, Benson, Canada Lake, Blackbridge, Stewart Landing and Upper Benson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern New York.
